Subject: RE: [junit] New Classes when refactoring

MIME-Version: 1.0

From: "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@...>

 
    > One of the preconditions for refactoring is the existence 
    > of a test
    > case which is then used to verify that the refactoring 
    > didn't break
    > anything.  So, I claim that you should always use your 
    > original test,
    > and then add more if necessary.

Correction - "add more WHEN necessary".

The when is easily defined as "before" you create the other class.  This is
real test first design, but you may not like that (but, why wouldn't you
like it :).

Tests will most likely always be necessary!

-Jason
subject: RE: [junit] New Classes when refactoring
